intro: Hieracium dolichaetum, commonly known as the long-hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, which help it retain moisture in dry environments. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Hieracium dolichaetum is often found in open habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
